column4: Hi, could some help me with mounting some hard drives connected via a sata raid card (I'm using jbod) -- I've pasted dmesg output here:  http://paste.ubuntu.com/184454/
do a fdisk -l
it returns nothing....
sudo fdisk -l
actually (once I run as sudo) it returns info on partitions for the drives that are already mounted.
no
it shows devices that system connect to
also sudo gparted gives an error message of "no devices found"
sudo fdisk -l and give me result
http://paste.ubuntu.com/184456/
Disk /dev/sdc: 1000.2 GB, 1000204886016 bytes
it's sdc, not sdd
no, sdc is a usb connected external hd
but remember check everything correctly before doing anything with fdisk
none of the *new* drives are listed on the "sudo fdisk -l"
how many disk you have?
you dont give me all what fdisk -l say
where is this line: Partition table entries are not in disk order
I don't see that line...
btw:  here what I see when I use sfdisk...: http://paste.ubuntu.com/184461/
try unplug new disk, plug again
